Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk efibootmgr
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: efibootmgr bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The efibootmgr utility is responsible for the boot loader installation on Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) systems. The efibootmgr packages have been upgraded to upstream version 0.8.0, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1129435) This update also fixes the following bug: Previously, the efibootmgr utility could terminate unexpectedly when trying to remove entries from the boot order which have already been removed. This bug has been fixed and efibootmgr no longer crashes in the described case. (BZ#1168019, BZ#1188313) In addition, this update adds the following enhancements: With this update, the efibootmgr package has been modified to build successfully on host machines using the ARM 64-bit CPU architecture. (BZ#967969) This update adds the --remove-dups option to the efibootmgr utility. This option allows efibootmgr to remove duplicate entries in the BootOrder list. (BZ#1097396) With this update, the efivar utility, which is used to manipulate UEFI variables, has been added to the efibootmgr package. (BZ#1129831) Users of efibootmgr are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
